name: NPR
text:
In 1965, James Baldwin and William F. Buckley debated whether the American dream "is at the expense of the American Negro." Now, the Atlantic's David Frum and Harvard's Khalil Muhammad are reimagining that debate for the March on Washington Film Festival.
https://t.co/3CJUCHDB4L

name: NPR
text:
As U.S. employers shed millions of permanent, full-time jobs, people are increasingly having to turn to freelancing as a means of survival.

And some experts say that shift is likely to continue.
https://t.co/jfejihv5vY

name: NPR
text:
Under the new deal, Oracle will host all of TikTok's U.S. user data and will safeguard TikTok's computer systems "to ensure U.S. national security requirements are fully satisfied," TikTok said in a statement.
https://t.co/flVJ8McRsK

name: NPR
text: Democratic Sen. Cory Booker, who sits on the judiciary committee, told NPR on Sunday that he believes lawmakers should let the winner of November's presidential election select a nominee. https://t.co/W0cxUqJA9g
